title: How to keep my family from over stepping my parenting skills - Quora

response.answer_text: Speak up and if they don't follow your rules go home and they miss seeing your children. My parents liked keeping grandkids for weekends and dad didn’t respect the boy’s diet. They feed kids everything they wanted and dad told the boy he could have pop with sugar. He gained weight at their house. His mom had him on a weight loss diet and was having to be strict telling he ate enough and her work was undone. He was informed if the boy gained at all at his house he couldn’t keep him. Everyone needs to respect parental rights, diet, bedtime, tv or whatever. Unless they are abusive they have rights to raise their children their way.

It’s actually really bad for anyone to contradict your parenting skills in front of the children. I think you need to sit down with the offenders alone and let them know that you’re not okay with that. Whether you want it or not though, you should also let them know you’re open to constructive criticism as long as it is not done in front of the children and if the person cannot contain themselves in the presence of the children, you’ll refrain from spending time with them and the children at the same time.
Set boundaries. You know when you aren’t there, they have to do it their way, but when you are there, interrupt their parenting attempt and say “It’s OK Mom, I’ve got this.” Then do it your way.
